subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Asafa Powell of Jamaica, the former record-holder in the 100 meters, ran an impressive 9.96 seconds in Trinidad on his return to competition from a shoulder injury sustained while lifting weights. The race, into a slight headwind with persistent drizzle, was Powell’s first since February. Since then, his countryman Usain Bolt has set the record, with a 9.72 on Randalls Island on May 31.
